Definition: Facial paralysis is the loss of movement in the muscles of the face, often affecting one side.
Causes: Viral infections, trauma, or neurological conditions.
Symptoms: Inability to close the eye, drooping of the mouth, and loss of facial expression.
Treatment: Physical therapy, medications, and sometimes surgery.

Definition: Facial trauma refers to injuries to the face, including fractures and soft tissue injuries.
Fallopian tube cancer is a rare cancer that occurs in the fallopian tubes.
Causes: Exact cause is unknown, but may involve genetic factors.
Symptoms: Abnormal vaginal bleeding, pelvic pain, and abdominal swelling.

Definition: Fecal incontinence is the inability to control bowel movements, leading to involuntary leakage.
Causes: Muscle damage, nerve damage, and certain medical conditions.
Symptoms: Involuntary loss of stool and urgency.
Diagnosis: Medical history, physical examination, and sometimes imaging.
Treatment: Dietary changes, medications, and pelvic floor exercises.

Definition: Female infertility is the inability to conceive after one year of unprotected intercourse.
Causes: Ovulation disorders, fallopian tube damage, and uterine conditions.
Symptoms: Inability to conceive and irregular menstrual cycles.
Diagnosis: Medical history, physical examination, and fertility tests.
Treatment: Medications, assisted reproductive technologies, and surgery.

Definition: Female pattern baldness is a common form of hair loss in women, often hereditary.
Treatment: Medications, hair restoration techniques, and lifestyle changes.

Definition: Fever is a temporary increase in body temperature, often due to illness.
Causes: Infections, inflammatory conditions, and heat exhaustion.
Symptoms: Elevated body temperature, chills, and sweating.
Treatment: Rest, hydration, and medications to reduce fever.

Definition: Fibrodysplasia ossificans progressiva is a rare genetic disorder that causes soft tissues to turn into bone.
Symptoms: Progressive loss of mobility and formation of bone in muscles and tendons.
Treatment: No cure; management focuses on preventing complications.

Definition: Fibromyalgia is a chronic condition characterized by widespread musculoskeletal pain.
Causes: Exact cause is unknown, but may involve genetic and environmental factors.
Symptoms: Widespread pain, fatigue, and sleep disturbances.
Treatment: Medications, physical therapy, and lifestyle changes.

Definition: Fibrosarcoma is a rare type of cancer that arises from fibrous connective tissue.
Causes: Exact cause is unknown, but may involve genetic mutations.
Symptoms: A lump or mass, pain, and swelling.

Definition: A fistula is an abnormal connection between two body parts, often due to injury or disease.
Treatment: Surgery and management of underlying conditions.

Definition: Influenza, or the flu, is a contagious respiratory illness caused by influenza viruses.
Causes: Influenza viruses A, B, and C.
Symptoms: Fever, cough, sore throat, and body aches.
Diagnosis: Clinical evaluation and sometimes rapid tests.
Treatment: Rest, hydration, antiviral medications, and symptomatic relief.

Definition: Focal segmental glomerulosclerosis is a kidney disease that affects the glomeruli.
Symptoms: Swelling, protein in urine, and high blood pressure.
Diagnosis: Urine tests, blood tests, and kidney biopsy.
Treatment: Medications, dietary changes, and sometimes dialysis.

Definition: Folliculitis is the inflammation of hair follicles, often due to infection.
Causes: Bacterial infections, irritation, and fungal infections.
Symptoms: Red bumps, itching, and pus-filled blisters.
Treatment: Topical antibiotics, warm compresses, and good hygiene.

Definition: A food allergy is an immune response to certain foods that the body mistakenly identifies as harmful.
Causes: Genetic predisposition and exposure to allergens.
Symptoms: Hives, swelling, gastrointestinal issues, and anaphylaxis.
Treatment: Avoidance of allergens and emergency medications like epinephrine.

Definition: Foot drop is a condition characterized by difficulty lifting the front part of the foot.
Causes: Nerve injury, muscle disorders, and neurological conditions.
Symptoms: Inability to lift the foot, dragging of the foot while walking.
Diagnosis: Physical examination and nerve conduction studies.
Treatment: Physical therapy, braces, and addressing underlying causes.

Definition: Frequency urination is the need to urinate more often than usual.
Causes: Urinary tract infections, diabetes, and bladder conditions.
Symptoms: Increased urge to urinate and sometimes discomfort.
Diagnosis: Medical history, physical examination, and urine tests.
Treatment: Depends on the underlying cause; may include medications and lifestyle changes.

Definition: Frostbite is an injury caused by freezing of the skin and underlying tissues.
Symptoms: Numbness, discoloration, and blistering of the skin.
Diagnosis: Physical examination and assessment of symptoms.
Treatment: Rewarming, pain management, and sometimes surgical intervention.

Definition: Frozen shoulder, or adhesive capsulitis, is a condition characterized by stiffness and pain in the shoulder joint.
Symptoms: Pain and limited range of motion in the shoulder.
Treatment: Physical therapy, medications, and sometimes surgery.
